questions.text: A 68-year-old man with a history of myocardial infarction and congestive heart failure is unable to carry out any physical activity without discomfort. Which of the following is his New York Heart Association classification?

A 59-year-old man presents with several episodes of substernal chest pressure of 15 minutes’ duration, which was brought on by an argument with his neighbour. His pain is relieved by nitroglycerine. According to the Forrester and Diamond chest pain classification, this patient’s angina would be described as:
Match the following findings with their causes

Read the following statements. Statement A is assertion and statement B is reason. Statement A: Y descent is absent in cardiac tamponade Statement B: There is RV diastolic collapse in cardiac tamponade Mark the appropriate option using the following key-

options.label: A
options.text: Both assertion and reason are correct and the reason is correct explanation of assertion

options.label: B
options.text: Both assertion and reason are correct but reason is not the correct explanation of assertion

options.label: C
options.text: Assertion is correct but reason is incorrect statement

options.label: D
options.text: Both reason and assertion are incorrect statements

questions.correct_answer: A. Both assertion and reason are correct and the reason is correct explanation of assertion

questions.text: Positive Hepatojugular reflex in JVP is suggestive of
Which of the following is associated with diffuse apex beat
Identify the condition in which this low pitch sound marked as ? is heard

A 34-year-old man presents with a family history of bicuspid aortic valve disease. On auscultation, a loud murmur is heard at the upper sternal border. No thrill is palpable. How should this murmur be graded?
Murmur of mitral regurgitation is
A patient is referred for a murmur. The murmur morphology is shown in the figure. The causes include all of the following except:

options.label: D
options.text: Mixed aortic valve disease (aortic stenosis and aortic regurgitation)

questions.correct_answer: D. Mixed aortic valve disease (aortic stenosis and aortic regurgitation)

questions.text: All of the following physical examination findings would suggest a diagnosis of aortic insufficiency except:

A 76-year-old woman with severe aortic stenosis presents with dyspnea and worsening functional class in the setting of new-onset atrial fibrillation. Which of the following auscultatory findings would not be expected?
Which of the following pathologies can be associated with an early diastolic murmur?

A 35-year-old woman with a history of rheumatic fever presents to your office in consultation for intermittent palpitations and worsening dyspnea. A physical exam reveals a diastolic murmur over the apex. Thyroid studies are within normal limits. Which of the following ECG findings is least likely to be observed in this patient?

options.label: D
options.text: T-wave inversions in II, III, aVF

questions.correct_answer: D. T-wave inversions in II, III, aVF

questions.text: Which of the following statements about hypertension management is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: ACE inhibitors may cause hypoglycemic unawareness

options.label: B
options.text: The coexistence of diabetes and hypertension increases the risk of future cardiovascular disease compared to hypertension alone

options.label: C
options.text: The incidence of new hypertension is very low in cancer patients undergoing chemotherapy treatment with vascular endothelial growth factor (VEGF) inhibitors such as bevacizumab

options.label: D
options.text: Once a stroke has occurred, antihypertensive drug therapy cannot help prevent additional cerebrovascular pathology and disease

questions.correct_answer: B. The coexistence of diabetes and hypertension increases the risk of future cardiovascular disease compared to hypertension alone

questions.text: Patient presenting with mental retardation and hypercalcemia is most likely have which defect

A 70-year-old man with a history of diabetes, coronary artery disease (CAD), and hypertension has now developed diabetic nephropathy. Which of the following drug will be useful for managing hypertension?

A 35 year old female with RHD presented come for routine check up. She has a pansystolic murmur at apex which radiated to axilla. Apex beat is displaced laterally.LVS3 is present. ECG shows sinus rhythm. On ECHO LVEF is 40% with regurgitant blood volume 70 ml/beat. What will be the appropriate step in management of this patient

A 32-year-old female with past history of rheumatic fever (20 years back) that was treated with antibiotics. She is asymptomatic. Her physical examination shows a heart rate of 70 beats per minute with a blood pressure of 122/77 mm Hg. She has no jugular venous distention. Her lungs are clear. She has a regular rate and rhythm with a loud S1. An early diastolic murmur is heard at the apex with an opening snap after S2. There is wide separation between A2 and the opening snap. No peripheral edema is present. Which of the following is the most appropriate next recommendation for this patient?

A 22-year-old man comes for routine check up as he is concerned with a family history of sudden death and arterial aneurysms. He is quite tall and oral cavity examination revealed the finding as shown in the figure(A). On examination a murmur is heard (figure B). What is the most likely cause?
Which of the following cardiac lesions has the highest risk of developing endocarditis?

A 65 year old man presents with a 4-week history of fever, general malaise and lethargy. He attends the emergency department and has blood cultures taken and he undergoes an echocardiogram, which shows a mass on his mitral valve. Conjunctival petechiae and tender finger tips are noted. What is the most likely organism that will be grown from his blood cultures?
What is the most common complication of infective endocarditis?

An 18-year-old woman has a raised C-reactive protein, a rash as shown in the figure, joint pain(without redness or increased temperature) of single joint area and fever. How many Jones criteria of rheumatic fever are fulfilled here if this patient is from high prevalence area of rheumatic fever

A 43-year-old woman with a past history of breast cancer is referred with a gradual onset of breathlessness. An echocardiogram demonstrates a dilated poorly contracting left ventricle. Which of the following would be an irreversible cause of her dilated cardiomyopathy?

A 55 year old woman presents with a history of acute, severe, constricting central chest pain associated with anterior ST segment elevation on the 12-lead ECG. She immediately undergoes coronary angiography, which shows no evidence of coronary artery disease and no coronary occlusion. An echocardiogram shows left ventricular apical dilatation, with normal left ventricular basal contraction. Which of the following factors is most likely to have precipitated this illness?
True about Barth syndrome are all except
questions.correct_answer: A. Equal male and female prevalence

questions.text: A 23-year-old woman came for a routine health check up. Her mother died suddenly at age 47, and a brother is on medications for a heart murmur. On examination, her vital signs are normal, her neck veins are normal, and her lungs clear. The apex impulse is forceful, and she has an S4 gallop. Auscultation reveals systolic ejection murmur at Erb’s area without radiation. Valsalva maneuver increases the intensity of the murmur. What is the likely cause of this clinical presentation?

A 37-year-old woman presents with new-onset shortness of breath and orthopnea. She is noted to have an ejection fraction of 30%. Her history is remarkable for having recently delivered a baby boy 4 months ago. Which of the following is needed for a diagnosis of peripartum cardiomyopathy?

options.label: A
options.text: The cardiomyopathy must be an idiopathic condition

options.label: B
options.text: The onset of the cardiomyopathy must be related to the timing of pregnancy

questions.text: CHF is associated with increase in all the following except

A 78-year-old man is admitted to the intensive care unit with decompensated heart failure. He has longstanding ischemic cardiomyopathy. ECG shows atrial fibrillation and left bundle branch block. Chest radiograph shows cardiomegaly and bilateral alveolar infiltrates with Kerley B lines. Which of the following is least likely to be present on physical examination?
Aortic dissection originating from descending aorta and extending below diaphragm is
questions.correct_answer: D. Stanford type B + Debakey IIIB

questions.text: A 52-year-old female cigarette smoker presents with chest pain and ST segment elevations in leads V4 to V6 on a 12-lead ECG, which abruptly resolve accompanied by the resolution of chest pain with a dose of sublingual nitroglycerin in the emergency room. She undergoes coronary angiography, which demonstrates only a 60% stenosis in the circumflex artery. A diagnosis of variant angina is made. All of the following are potentially beneficial treatments except:
What ECG features would suggest right coronary artery occlusion?
Identify the wall of myocardial infarction in this ECG
LDH ‘flip’ seen in myocardial infarction is
questions.correct_answer: B. LDH I/LDH II greater than 1

questions.text: A 56 year old man presents with sudden onset of chest pain radiating down his left arm, ST segment depression of the ECG as shown in the figure and elevated plasma troponin concentration . Which of the following treatments is likely to worsen his prognosis?

Three months after an anterior MI, a 73-year-old man has a follow-up ECG. He is clinically feeling well with no further angina symptoms. His ECG shows with persistent ST-segment elevation. The current ECG is most compatible with which of the following diagnosis?
A patient with crepitations at lung bases and s3 belongs to which Killip class of myocardial infarction

An 85 year old man presents with a 6-month history of sudden episodes of light-headedness, which last up to 15 seconds. He is admitted to hospital with an episode of syncope resulting in facial injury. Examine the rhythm strip below. Which conduction abnormality does this show?

options.label: B
options.text: Wenckebach (Mobitz type I) second-degree AV block

options.label: C
options.text: Mobitz type II second degree block

questions.correct_answer: C. Mobitz type II second degree block

questions.text: Most likely diseased site in this ECG
A 75 year old woman has a history of hypertension and diabetes. She presents with atrial fibrillation. What is her CHA 2 DS 2 -VASc score?
Which of the following patients is a suitable candidate for an implantable cardiac defibrillator?

options.label: A
options.text: 26 year old man with polymorphic ventricular tachycardia (torsades de pointes) occurring after cocaine use

options.label: B
options.text: A 48 year old man who presents with acute inferior myocardial infarction complicated within the first 6 hours by ventricular fibrillation

options.label: C
options.text: A 55 year old woman with syncope; ECG monitoring shows sinus rhythm with third-degree atrioventricular block

options.label: D
options.text: An 80 year old man with a history of anterior myocardial infarction 6 months previously; he is fit, has never experienced arrhythmia, and a cardiac magnetic resonance scan shows poor left ventricular function (left ventricular ejection fraction 28%)

questions.correct_answer: D. An 80 year old man with a history of anterior myocardial infarction 6 months previously; he is fit, has never experienced arrhythmia, and a cardiac magnetic resonance scan shows poor left ventricular function (left ventricular ejection fraction 28%)

questions.text: A 43-year-old woman is seen in the emergency department after sudden onset of palpitations. Her heart rate is 17 bpm and blood pressure is 98/56 mmHg with normal oxygen saturation. On physical examination there is tachycardia but is otherwise normal. ECG done is shown in the figure. Which of the following is the most appropriate first step to manage her tachycardia?
Which of the following is not true about Brugada syndrome?

options.label: A
options.text: Brugada syndrome is associated with structural heart disease like dilated CMP.

options.label: B
options.text: Brugada syndrome is associated with mutations in SCN5A.

options.label: C
options.text: The ECG manifestations of Brugada syndrome can be induced with drugs like ajmaline

options.label: D
options.text: Arrhythmia can be exacerbated by fevers

questions.correct_answer: A. Brugada syndrome is associated with structural heart disease like dilated CMP.

questions.text: A 63-year-old man is brought to the emergency room with altered level of consciousness and is found to be tachycardic and hypotensive. Echocardiography reveals a large pericardial effusion with echocardiographic evidence of tamponade. Which of the following is not appropriate in the subsequent management of this patient with cardiac tamponade?

options.label: A
options.text: If a pericardial catheter is placed, removal of the intrapericardial catheter when the output is < 90 mL over a 24-hour period

options.label: B
options.text: Prompt needle pericardiocentesis to aspirate all the pericardial fluid

options.label: C
options.text: Pericardiocentesis should be guided by echocardiography to prevent tissue injury

options.label: D
options.text: All of the above are correct

questions.correct_answer: A. If a pericardial catheter is placed, removal of the intrapericardial catheter when the output is < 90 mL over a 24-hour period

questions.text: This ecg is seen in

A 40-year-old man is found to have edema, ascites, and hepatomegaly. Pulsus paradoxus is present. The examination of his neck veins reveals elevated venous pressure with a deep y descent. Apex beat is not localised. Heart size on x-ray is normal. Which of the following etiologies is not a possible explanation for this syndrome?
Restrictive cardiomyopathy is differentiated from constrictive pericarditis by which feature
A patient develops these ECG changes after an overdose of sotalol. Which one is NOT likely to be helpful in the management of this situation?

options.label: C
options.text: Intravenous bolus dose of magnesium sulphate

questions.correct_answer: D. Intravenous bolus dose of procainamide
